original_reasoning:
Okay, let's look at the code that needs to be completed. The task is to fill in the missing parts. The first missing part is where the comment says "Create a new DateTime instance for the current date and time". The line has DateTime currentDateTime = /* TODO */;.

Hmm, I remember that in Joda-Time, to get the current date and time, you can just call the constructor without parameters. So for DateTime, it should be new DateTime(). So that's probably the answer here.

Wait, let me check the other lines. The LocalDate and LocalTime instances are created using new LocalDate() and new LocalTime(), which also use the default constructors for current date/time. That makes sense. So the DateTime should follow the same pattern. Therefore, the missing line is simply new DateTime();.

No other parts are missing except that one line. The rest of the code seems filled out. The user just needs to provide that one line. So the answer is to replace the TODO comment with new DateTime().
